meanings.def: not in a room, building or container but on or to the outside of it
examples: I'm seeing a patient—please wait outside.
I stood outside in the corridor, looking through the window.
The house is painted green outside.
It's warm enough to eat outside.
Go outside and see if it's raining.
The heat hits you as soon as you step outside.

meanings.def: on or to a place on the outside of something
examples: You can park your car outside our house.

meanings.def: away from or not in a particular place
examples: It's the biggest theme park outside the United States.
We live in a small village just outside Leeds.
The matter is outside my area of responsibility.
You may do as you wish outside working hours.

meanings.def: more than the amount of time mentioned
examples: The winning time was just nine seconds outside the world record.
There was nothing they could do, outside of hoping things would get better.

meanings.def: the outer side or surface of something
examples: The outside of the house needs painting.
He flicked the ball into the top of the net with the outside of his left foot.
from the outside You can't open the door from the outside.
on the outside Meat and poultry cooked on a grill often browns very fast on the outside.
Cook until crispy on the outside and cooked through.

meanings.def: the area that is near or around a building, etc.
examples: I walked around the outside of the building.
from the outside I didn't go into the temple—I only saw it from the outside.

meanings.def: the part of a road nearest to the middle
examples: on the outside Always overtake on the outside.

meanings.def: the part of a curving road or track furthest from the inner or shorter side of the curve
at the most; as a maximum
examples: There was room for 20 people at the outside.

meanings.def: used to describe how somebody appears or seems
examples: On the outside she seems calm, but I know she's worried.
Life on the outside took some getting used to again.

idioms.def: at the most; as a maximum
examples: There was room for 20 people at the outside.

idioms.def: used to describe how somebody appears or seems
examples: On the outside she seems calm, but I know she's worried.
Life on the outside took some getting used to again.

meanings.def: of, on or facing the outer side
examples: The outside walls are damp.
Potted flowers lined the outside edges of the steps.
At 35,000 feet the outside air temperature is about 55 degrees below zero.

meanings.def: not located in the main building; going out of the main building
examples: an outside toilet
You have to pay to make outside calls.
I can't get an outside line.

meanings.def: not included in or connected with your group, organization, country, etc.
examples: We plan to use an outside firm of consultants.
She has a lot of outside interests (= not connected with her work).
They felt cut off from the outside world (= from other people and from other things that were happening).
It soon became clear that they would have to seek outside help.
an outside observer/consultant/expert
I try to ignore all outside influences and just write for myself.

meanings.def: used to say that something is very unlikely
examples: They have only an outside chance of winning.
150 is an outside estimate (= it is very likely to be less).
